google_play_reviews.content: Takes a little getting used to, but far superior to the alternative! (The alternative being tw¬°tter, lol). No ads. No spam. No nonsense pushed on your timeline, more characters allowed to be used on a single post, easy to find people and common interests, and hashtags are not pushing some outrage-farming algorithm or controversial content. Fediverse needs more users and deserves more popularity. Good app.
I love the fediverse ü•≥
mastodon is better than twitter
Functions similar to Twitter or Reddit, but is harder to navigate imo. I don't really use it honestly.
I just don't wanna see replys on my timeline.
clean easy to use app
Much much much worse than Twitter üëé Their admin is not friendly. I've just deleted my account and uninstall the app.

Theres not supposed to be an official app, but this one uses the logo, which is supposed to be reserved for official instances, per the creator of mastodon. I cant open mastodon.social links in it or mute threads w/out going to the in-app browser and having to login. I cant find any help other than some corporate ad copy about how theyre not supposed to be like twitter. Ok, but why are you trying to be like twitter then? You should at least have a seamless experience within the same instance.
Meh
Welcoming experience

It's easy to use, it's compatible with screen reader software like Talkback... The only real challenge in the long run is finding an instance that best suits you and your interests, and even if you pick the wrong one, you can transfer your account over to one you think would work better. All in all, I like it.
Set up an account and logged in about a year ago. There isn't a search or any topics or anything. This is the worst "social" concept possible.
Super fast and clean!

Joined in the whole SM debacle, now staying because it's just more homely. This is what I want a social media network to be. Crowd funded, the community itself actually runs the platform through their own servers with their own rules, and it's open source. I'm joining its Patreon and aim to contribute more in the future. Also, no ads. Absolutely none. ‚ù§Ô∏è A few caveats exist but it can only get better. I am moving my social media presence here. It just makes sense to me with how things work.
Great
Best alternative for twitter
As a former Twitter user, this place is way better. No ads, no Musk, absolute win.
Seems to work well enough, but I'm unable to follow hashtags from the Mastodon app. The app has also stopped recognizing my password so I'm not able to add 2FA.
Nice service. Is it free?
Doesn't work, get API error all the time.
Drags behind iOS Overall a really nice and pleasant app to use, but I can't wait to get an ability to follow hashtags and translate posts just like I can on an iPhone or iPad üôå
üôèRadhe Radheüôè

#1 reason to skip this app: feature parity's very poor. No lists, bookmarks, DMs, local/federated feeds. (Editing your posts was only made available as recently as December 2022.) I personally wish the app UI would be the same as the mobile website, with option to shift the top bar and sidebar towards the bottom for ergonomics. Also: clicking on links to posts in other servers redirects you away, so you can't like, boost, or comment (other clients address this). App feels high quality otherwise.
I don't get notificationsü´§
doesn't work. the app opens but nothing will load. just shows an error on every page
Easy to use, smooth, with just enough going on. üñ§
It's the fediverse. What else do you need?

It's a safe place for people that fear inconvenient truths and need an echo chamber to safeguard against their childish hatred taking over when they see opinions they don't agree with. The bulk of the user base is only here because they can't handle people that have different political views on Twitter ü§£
Accessibility is a VERY big problem in the app. I can't even tap the star or reblog icons anymore "Error parsing an API error" toasts whenever I try to do something.
why is app filled with arabic letters?
Can get it to work ,not even a search

Retardation is how I describe it. I use randomly generated 35 character passwords.. this stupid thing wants me to type it in the confirm password field, doesn't accept autofill or pasting. Here's a word to the devs: sit on it!

Perfect app! I tried a number of paid and free ones -this has all the basic tools at perfection. Please add an option for voluntary donations. This would encourage developers to put some extra time fine tuning the app!
Rubbish app.... Rarely opens....keeps saying handshake failed.... what a joke.... your wasting your time.
This is my new favorite place to hang out. The people here are friendly and interesting and there's no shortage of cool content. Best of all this app takes up very little space.
What really make me Excited with Mastodon Is The App Size, mastadon is not lite but < 2mb the Ux and UI is also good
Not seeing any way to log onto multiple different instances or servers...
I tried to log in to my account on this app but all I keep getting is "invalid email address". And it still hasn't changed.
Mastodon is politically sensitive and eliminates accurate postings and their users if you disagree with their politics. App removed.
Masih bagus Twitter

So Far Link to Creat New Acct Doesn't Work. I dunno what's going on, but link to create account that they email you never sends. I've requested a new one several times now. When I click the button to "Open Email App", it takes me to a Samsung (my phone) app that I never use on purpose. There is no alternative. Hitting the 'back button' arrow doesn't take you anywhere. I even uninstalled, reinstalled, did the process again, no luck. UPDATE: emailed creator, no reply. Uninstalled.

Created account on web. Trying to dl the app. It just keeps grinding with the message "retrieving server info". Is it supposed to take this long? Have to give it a 1 star bc I haven't been able to actually use the app yet... Edit: ok, just got in finally, but still leaving it at 1 bc the UI is not very intuitive.
its ok, please add federated feed
An entirely functional client for Mastodon, very similar to the web app. It's clumsy in the way Mastodon is, sadly they didn't use the app as an opportunity to smooth out some rough edges.
I'm happy with it. There are a few minor things it can't do or are not obvious how to do vs the website.
Not bad but would like to ability to have Lists. Swiping between lists. Otherwise the feed becomes overwhelming.
I want to use this as an alternative to Twitter but images on this app just won't load for me. It's all blanks :( I waited a day to see if the issue resolved itself but still images won't load
app needs a way to search Gpics got thousands but it starts with last and thinks I should scroll thru. Profile functionality needs help
Great app. Work on the reply to comments. It's painful to read replies to a toot.
please enable the option to get notifications when one of my following makes a post
Easy to use, and it makes it pretty easy to understand the differences between Mastodon and Twitter.
Do yourself a favor and use a third party alternative. I find tusky pretty well designed.

Needs to have all of the same functionality as the web interface. Especially Approval Voting style polls. Otherwise pretty good. Known bugs, Pixel 7, Android 13: Google translate fails to launch and translate highlighted text.

The only viable alternative to Twitter. I would highly recommend using "Megalodon" instead of this app, as it has more features, but I'm still giving 5 stars because... its mastodon and i want to support it.
I enjoy it. it connects to people well.
Beats the pants of the bird app!
Seems confusing ü§î
Can be a bit clunky and slow sometimes, but the lack of ads more than makes up for it. A far better and more enjoyable experience than any of the bigger social media apps
Just make one server. No meed of different servers, canada nyc,,,,one should be enough
Keeps crashing

I simply can't use it. I went through the setup, but never received the confirmation email. (This is likely due to my email provider, ATT.) I would like to go back and use a different email address, but the app now launches only to the confirmation page with the option of resending the mail or opening the mail app. Dead before I even started.

I thought I'd find a good quality social media app but it's just an airtight eco-chamber for your political views with a ridiculous anti-ringwing bias. This is just twitter for hyper-sensitive people.
Leave the app and message disappears ... it should not do this .... make drafts a thing or the app is always going to be worse than alternatives.

Promising, but ultimately frustrating. The people I've encountered on the platform have been great. My problem is that the platform itself seems really unstable. Joined an instance appropriate to me, had some positive interactions, then I couldn't access the instance any more. Don't know if the app glitched, the instance got deleted or I got kicked out for reasons unknown. Update: Much improved since my last review. All of the previously mentioned issues have been dealt with.

The app looks good, nice UI, but some very important features are missing: choose the language you're using when tooting, change the focus point of a thumbnail, add a tab where you can follow hashtags, add a DM tab...
This app is racist they banned me just for writing hashtag in my language and promoting human rights for my minority
Text fonts tiny but it seems to work

Created an account on my laptop. Was using Mastodon happily. Suddenly, I couldn't get in. Password didn't work, even my bookmark disappeared, which is strange. Tried creating a 'new' acct with the same credentials, thinking the account got deleted by accident. Got an error message saying email and password were taken! Then, why couldn't I get in?? 'Forgot your password' gets no link. No response to emails. Have recovery codes, can't use them. Really disappointed with Mastodon.
Stuck on screen "one last thing.
Overall it's good But UI needs to be more polished.
Only shows home not local or federated.
Cool decentralised medium, but you need a separate account for every server. Thats like one discord account per one server. There ar external software to solve this issue but impractical
If you provide atleast 1 follower I would have given 5 stars. Is this a social app.
Having trouble with photos a videos but it is a functional social media app
A nice, open source, free to use and privacy respecting application for sharing posts. The application currently isn't the best Mastodon client, but it's absolutely functional and works as expected.
Decent but the app irregularly fails to preserve content warnings on replies. Needs to be fixed.
This isn't Twitter so I assume it is way better

I got attacked by ppl and called names. Some guy made fun of my screen name and called me a "stupid broad". They called where I live a "sh*th*le" right off the bat. I'm not sure why anybody would want to interact with such awful ppl. (There were a few nice ppl too) But most were just absolutely mental. I'm not putting up with that. (At least the flock over at blue bird never tried to peck me to death on my 1st week!) Now I can't log in to delete my account. What a pathetic joke of a site!

Pretty good except for two issues: 1) Links in profiles or toots to other profiles (or toots) open in the in-app browser rather than as expected (in the app) 2) Switching apps and returning while composing a toot loses the toot. No sign of a preserved draft anywhere. This one bites me a lot.
App wouldn't start up for minutes, and when it did and I finally figured out how to work it, ever since my phone has been super slow, I don't know what this app did to my phone but I don't like it.
Should have translator
Showing as malware. Probably just early days. I'll give it a chance however twitter has had one chance too many in my opinion.
It's not Twitter, and thank God for that.
Twitter has replaced Craig's List.
Only been using for a short time and still getting used to the new platform. Not as intuitive as fb for computer phobes.

Where is the widget?? Like I'm still learning the app and it's features, but what is missing is a timeline widget. Crazy to think it wasn't included. Other thing I'm not sure about is if I can manage multiple accounts, not looking that way though. Otherwise, it is a clean GUI and easy to use
Getting better by the day. Good layout and features. Works well on my device
One of the worst app. I was waiting for them to fix it. Now deleting it and moving to desktop version.

Cannot log on.
The app keeps crashing without warning of you try to attach a video or images are too big or there are too many of them... Took me 5 attempts to publish a post.
For some reason my images are not showing, it's a bit frustrating, hopefully more options will come to the app.
Nonsense extremely complicated Far too many servers
Love the 'fediverse'. This app is pretty good. Looking forward to exploring other ones.
Locked into the email confirmation page. Can't escape even with uninstalling.
Same situation as many others unable to get past the email verification screen, no way to reset or by pass, no way to resend or edit details, attempt new options, nothing. Just stuck.
Loving this app - not just for the positivity of the community, but also the clean look and feel. Oh, and there's an edit button!
Keeps stopping during login process. Uninstalled, reinstalled, yet same problem.
Nothing but good things

I created an account on my computer based on the reviews here saying how awful it was to sign up through the app, but spoiler alert: the app is still just as useless. It asks me to sign into my server and then throws me to a web page asking for authorization, but no matter how many times I tap Authorize, it just reloads the page, asking for authorization. I can't use the app unless the authorization goes through, so it's just...useless.
Must improve UI
It is ok
Missing features from the website. Crashes when putting two images in a toot

Great app with tons of content and user options

Generally decent. But whenever I try to upload videos there's no telling what the limit is. By trial and error I've learnt it's Ard 25mb. And when I share photos to toot, it sometimes boots me out and I have to start all over
One of the best alternatives to many big-name social media platforms, but It's not without a few rough edges that greatly hinder the overall experience.
It's okay but why does the app ignore the filters I set on the website? I filtered out a load of irrelevant rubbish but it all still appears on the app.

The app works pretty well for the most part, but it is a little slow to load images sometimes. Also, I REALLY hope the developers remove access to the Pawoo and Baraag instances, as these servers are littered with pedophiles and child pornography. These instances should not be accessible from an app like this.
Getting better, but buggy: filters created in the web interface *still* don't work in the app, which kills it for me. Also force closes when you try to upload more than one image in a post
Fantastic. So happy to have ditched Twitter. Removing one star as the UI could be more compact and/or customizable.

Great app. Little tough finding people of same interest considering they are spread across different servers. Good Twitter alternative.
Clunky and doesn't work well at all.
Can't log in. I choose the instance with my account on it, enter my email and password, and get "Security validation failed - are you blocking cookies?" To my knowledge I'm not blocking cookies.
Actually has a quite convenient UI. I hope soon we can also Quote RT instead of only RT-ing. I forgot other feedback that I wanna give. I'll be back when I remember hahaha

Good start
Same as other 1 stars unusable

The app gets better by the day. Thank you for fixing issues on a timely matter! Having an option to view the federated feed would be nice!

It's time for me to update my review of this App. Well, I'm mightily impressed! The App works very well, I've had no issues at all & I've been using it for about 5 weeks. Mastodon's a joy to be part of. Now Twitter's a nightmare to use, the Mastodon App has become my go to. I just need to find out how & where, I can contribute to the upkeep of the server that I'm on, & to the Mastodon ecosystem ingeneral. Help keep it Musk free!!!
Works well, with a limited but nice feature set
I have been waiting for a long time to get a confirmation email. I tried a month ago, and it never came, do I deleted the app. I'm trying again and I'm going through the same issue.
Worst app. I didn't get it how to operate. Wht r they trying to make. I wish I could give negative star to it.

I love that more people are joining
Great app so far!

App is shipping broken and is completely unusable. You sign in and it says that server validation fails. The platform itself is very badly designed. Its hard to find new content, find posts based on topics, etc.

Best Twitter alternative. The one star reviews come from a lack of understanding not because the app sucks. The best part is being part of a server. And no your not stuck to that one server you can still interact with others from other servers
2 major issues: - Refuses to attach any images for some reason most of the time - Does not load polls Otherwise is alright but god damn please fix it
Easy to use, nice and smooth. Simply awesome!

I love this app
twitter better üòπ

Nicely designed app, although clearly in its infancy. There doesn't seem to be a way to get notifications for accounts you follow, which is a bummer for me.
Fake.
Super alternative to twitter love it‚ô•Ô∏è

Update 7/23: Definitely improved with Version 2 release. Still needs list support. This official app meant to introduce people to Mastodon is so poorly executed that it's shameful. Not even the most basic features are included. It's slow and clunky. A big reason for that is the choice to build the app in Java. Ever heard of Flutter? Should look into it. This is not the experience that users should get when joining a new (to them) social media platform. Two stars is more than generous.
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Hi. If you would be so kind as to e-mail hello@joinmastodon.org, we would love to hear in which areas the app appears slow and clunky for you. Please keep in mind that the app connects to and loads data from your Mastodon server over the network, and a slow network or slow responses on the server may result in delays in the app.

google_play_reviews.content: I got banned because I stated that wars can not be fought if people refuse to fight in them and that I refuse to fight against any country my country wants to bully. I also called Biden a kiddy fiddler. Freedom of speech doesn't exist on mastodon. All the snowflakes on one app. Trust me, you are better off without.
Haven't even used it yet. Have an account, but I can't sign in. Genius! Make a platform, and then nobody can use it

The Fediverse is great, but arguably Mastodon is the least robust platform on this 'verse. Friendica is much more feature rich and let's you communicate with everyone on Mastodon. Even still the mobile website is better than this app, and if you feel the neec to use an app something line AndStatus or Fedilab is better than the "official" app
Nice try but far from reality. Unstable, glitchy, unpolished, below average.
Fairly decent but lacks a few features. I used this initially but found another app suits my needs better. Might try this again in a few updates.
All I want to do is log in to my account! I set it up on my computer, all I wanna do is log in on my Android phone. Why can't I do that? Why do I have to choose a server? Ridiculous..

+1 star for adding edit posts. Still like to follow hashtags with it. Twitter refugee loving this community. The app is not bad but i wish: 1. Edit posts like i can in browser 2. Open all Mastodon links (to Mastodon content) in the app What I love: 1. Very easy to follow people on other instances, just click follow, do not need to specify instance, etc. 2. Just get on Mastodon however you do it. No ads, no user tracking, no algorithm.
Clean UI, but the app isn't very intuitive.

I've been using the App for weeks with no issues. Not sure why it's getting all these low reviews. Works as expected. I'm sure it can use some improvements, but I don't want people to think that the low score is representative of a lot of others users experiences. Mine has been quire pleasant.
Please hire QA
App is stuck on the resend email or open email app page... which opens the wrong email app anyway. And I haven't received any email
Semi good but needs work

When u open app, u cant simply access yr server. u must act as if u r a new user, then choose yr server (the 1 you already belong to), then login. But the list of available servers often doesnt include the 1 you're on. Makes for very frustrating experience. To be useful, the app would hv to permit you to directly login to your server. It's possible the only way to do this is for ea instance to have its own app, which seems ridiculous. But that may be the only way
google_play_reviews.replyContent: We've made the login screen less confusing in the latest update. You could of course always enter your server name directly.

google_play_reviews.content: This thing absolutely destroys Twitter on so many levels. Not only do you get to sign up for whatever server you want, you can sign up on multiple servers to have multiple accounts with the same name and different websites oh, for different things. So like, you can have one where you talk about business, on a professional server, and one where you talk about ponies on a server like Pony.Social, and even one on a server you run yourself.
If you like Twitter and microblogging,you will love it. Better than Purk!

Decent app, covers the basics. Good presentation. Works well on Pixel phone (Android 13) and Samsung S5e tablet (Android 11). An option to change font size would be nice. Also would prefer the reblog icon to change to a more visible color after a reblog. Darkish blue is fairly indistinguishable from black to a large percentage of folks over 40.
The app is awful. Signing up is not good experience. It's not a good app at all. Going back to Twitter!

I really would like to migrate to mastodon but I can't stand to suckness of the search engine on mastodon. The thing that I enjoy the most on twitter is the ability to search words from other people posts. Pleae improve mastodon...
I can't get pass the confirmation email page. I tried re-installing the app, force stop and nothing worked.
Very bed apps.don't download

I really like mastodon. I've actually managed to follow people across different servers by using hashtags and the communities I've found are lovely. However I would like the mobile app to have the features of the web version, such as being able to follow hashtags and direct message people.
F*** this app! Developer makes it extremely difficult to sign up. But when you do, it's full of liberal bullsh*t.
Deleted after 4 minutes. Not a good app.

The first part of joining is a bit strange. I don't really know what I'm doing and I do have a fair amount of social and server experience.. Just downloaded it and trying to give it a try.. (giving average stars to be fair)..
Stuck in an endless loop trying to login. Super complex and difficult to just login. 0/10 do not recommend.
Was quite happy with it, until I had to remove an account and add a new one - it simply refuses to authorize my new account; the button doesn't work, effectively making the app unusable.
Had this on my phone. Uninstalled to try Tooot. Couldn't get Tooot to load. Uninstalled Tooot. Re installed Mastodon and now it won't authorize for me.

Nicely done app, good UI and easy to navigate. If you're interested in the mastodon network definitely check it out. However I feel this app does need an option for the federated timeline, and is missing many features.
I got this the day we all thought that Twitter was ending. I found it overcomplicated and slow. Perhaps it will better when I get back to it.
Easy to use, fun to interact with!
good app
Works fine. You can even switch accounts. Basic functionality -- nothing more is needed desperately. Bells and whistles can wait.

It's not a bad app. Got a lot of potential but I occasionally have issues where it will say a list is empty when I know it isn't. It's also hard to find accounts. And new content isn't always available, sometimes content gets recycled. But it is improving, I think it's worth being patient.

The app was pretty fine with me, until I began experiencing network problems. So, I tried logging out and in again. But to my utmost surprise,I have been consistently rejected until this moment...none of my Gmail or password is of any use to you anymore. Okay, I tried opening a new account to no avail. Now, I am suggesting; if there are specific categories of people you don't welcome, spell it out, rather than frustrate, and waste precious time and data. Or is it a crime to leave Twitter 4 you?
this is email meets microblogging. pick an instance you like the sound of. if you don't like that corner, change instance.

Could use some explanation or tutorial on how to start. One does not just know what it means to join a server, what the difference is and how to choose which server to join if non of the recommended ones match one's interest. I am not doing research to use another social media.

Mastodon is now my #1 go-to for my main social media communication üòä It's very refreshing to be on a platform with good vibes and authenticity. All the complaints about it being complicated or too hard to understand are bsüò§ If they could institute some stand out cool feat (like music on your profile) they would be the most perfect imo. Either way, I'm pleased. Oh and as others have noted in their reviews, only the racist and bigoted bird app nazis are rating this app lowüò§üñïüèæ
Having server issues cant post. Dont know how to switch servers

I refuse to give a high star rating for this app because I have attempted to create a unique username and strong password while I tried to sign up several times, but failed. Every time I tap on "Next", the word "forbidden" kept showing up on the screen. Forbidden what? Is my username forbidden? Password? I couldn't decide which. So I gave up and decided to delete the app.

When registering a new account the app gives you 2 options - open your email app or go back. When jumping out to your email app to confirm your email, you can't get to a main menu in the app. Even after rebooting. This makes the app unusable. I'm going to uninstall and reinstall. *** Update 12/1/22 - uninstalling and reinstalling takes you to a page that only allows the option to sign-up. Log-on option does not work. I'm on Android. In it's current state, it's unusable so I'm uninstalling.
I like the safe and quality environment. This social app filters the misleading and dangerous content away. Bravo!

The 'official' app, I think. Seemed the best place to start. It's good, but not perfect. Doesn't have all the functionality of the website. The most irritating thing at present? I can't see to choose basic icons - smiley faces, waving or clapping hands. I can only see to choose the additional icons my instance has chosen.
Absolutely fantastic that it's decentralized. Just let me see what people are discussing on the news page, though.
P.O.S. Don't bother unless looking for liberal antifa bs
Every single password I came up with was either forbidden or to many requests. This is not worth the hassle, I'll stay on twitter.
"Log on" button doesn't work, it takes you to the same "get started" interface. Fail at first hurdle as an app, back to using via Web
*Still waiting. .... I created page ok but unable to upload anything...need customer service
App is solid. I suspect the low ratings are due to brigaders
I wouldn't call it a Twitter alternative, but if you find that you're not a racist xenophobe then it's a nicer place to be.
My server (mastodon.social) is not listed and I can only choose from the list
First, this app is a joke. Extremely flawed, especially with registration and navigation. Second... lmao at the fascist echo chamber, thinking this will replace Twitter.
Don't believe the Twitter fascists downvottimg this app. Great so far.
The Matodon web interface allows users to follow hadhtags. The app didn't support this simple feature.

I tried setting up an account to switch off of Twitter but I'm stuck on the "One Last Thing" email page and nothing I do will get me off of it. I have verified my email but nothing happens. This app is unusable until that is fixed.

I don‚Äôt think they can handle all Elon exits. Slower than a turtle riding a snail. The separate server thing is a bit of a sweet-and-sour thing, but it would be nice if there was an option to join a combination of several servers. Or at least a general-purpose server that is a mishmash of all servers. Development on this app is a bit silly. Half the configuration is web-based, and the other half is on the app. Consistency is lacking. I hope this improves over time. As is, I don't know...
This app is waste...

Hopeless. I can login on the browser client but the app repeatedly tells me my email or password is incorrect. And yes I am selecting the correct instance. Sometimes it seems to open the phone browser as well and then I get a 401 invalid acces token. Pointless, broken app.
Hateful people on here. Ideas are oppressed. Stay far away.

Loving it so far. My only complaint is that when you've been away from the app for a while, and you hit "load more," it takes you to the top of your timeline, instead of leaving you where you left off, so you have to scroll to find your last spot. Past that, it's great!
Nice experience, would like option to edit in the app

Tried setting up. Couldn't get past the confirmation email and now the app is stuck with no way to go back or start over. Reboot just loads the same screen. Know I didn't spell it wrong because I pasted it from pinned clipboard, same way I do for everything else. Wanted to try because seems to be fair instead of being like Facebook and only banning "certain people" while letting others slide for worse; But if I can't get past registration or try a different email it is kind of useless.

Moved to Mastodon ever since Twitter got Musk'ed. I'm loving it, a very welcoming place with much less toxicity and the fact that it's not for profit and user centric as well as decentralized fediverse (which means no billionaire can just buy it unlike a centralized service like twitter) has brought me peace of mind. Welcome to the future of social media.

Overall the official app is pretty easy to use and works well. There are some issues that I find to be a no go and why I still use Tusky over this one. 1. When you load new posts it shoots you to the top of the list. This is the MOST disgusting aspect of this UI for me. Look at twitter for inspiration. When new tweets load in twitter you stay where you are in the feed and can keep scrolling up as you please right from where you left off. - Needs fixed immediately 2. The feed does not automatically update when new posts are available. - Make it an option 3. Not enough options to view things like followers and such like other reviewers have already mentioned. - Much needed 4. No way to view the fully federated view. - Might be too much for the average user. Fix 1,2 and 3 and you have a winner 100%

There are a few bugs that need polished, but dev seems to be responsive in fixing things as they're reported on github.

Joining mas.to seems to ask a read write permission to "Everything". I don't quite understand what this everything is, but I'm not willing to grant a social media app access to everything on my phone. It also asks permission to read all my push notificatios which I don't think it needs at all or deserves. So I don't seem to be able to use the app?
google_play_reviews.replyContent: That is not the Android permissions screen and it is not asking for your phone permissions. When you are logging in to a Mastodon account through an app, Mastodon asks you if it's OK to give the app permissions to access different Mastodon features using your account.

If you're going to keep deleting my comments because you don't like them then how am I supposed to believe your entire platform is better? I have issues with your UI. It's not intuitive. That's valid criticism.
google_play_reviews.replyContent: That is the OAuth authentication screen on your Mastodon server and it means access for the app to read and write everything on your Mastodon account.

google_play_reviews.replyContent: We are sorry you had a bad experience. The app is not responsible for moderation decisions made on any particular server. All Mastodon servers are operated independently (like e-mail providers, for example). You can sign-up on a different Mastodon server that has different moderation policies and moderators.

google_play_reviews.content: Un- and then re-installed the app after creating a new account. The new version is really ugly and not as sleek-looking as before. There are just some simple things you can't do on it, like tap on 'followers' or 'following' to see a list of those accounts, for example. I've also got Tusky installed at the moment, as I try to decide between the two. Tusky is more aesthetically pleasing, but that's not without it's problems either. I need this app to up its game and decide for me.

google_play_reviews.replyContent: You can long-press on your profile picture in the bottom bar to add more accounts. If you've got suggestions for how you imagine the login process could be simpler, e-mail us at hello@joinmastodon.org. Thank you!
